0.title: Centre indifferent to Indians in Ukraine: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
0.article_body: Congress' Lok Sabha leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has criticised the Centre for allegedly displaying "all kinds of apathy and indifference towards Indians" stranded in the war-hit Ukraine. "The (central) government was busy in campaigning for the elections when evacuation [activities] should have been given the top priority," added Chowdhury. He also accused PM Modi of "misleading" Indians.

1.title: UP CM Yogi interacts with Ukraine-returned students in Lucknow
1.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath interacted with students who have returned to India from Ukraine in Lucknow, on Sunday. "Thirty-three new medical colleges and two new AIIMS hospitals have been established in the state. In the next one year, there will be a medical college in every district of the state," CM Yogi added while interacting with the students.

2.title: India begins last leg of evacuation from Ukraine, asks students to reach Budapest
2.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday tweeted that India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today. "All those students staying in their own accommodation (other than arranged by Embassy) are requested to reach Hungaria city centre, Rakoczi Ut 90, Budapest between 10 am-12 pm," said the Embassy.

3.title: Indian student in Ukraine skips 4 flights, gives up luggage for her pet dog
3.article_body: A medical student in Ukraine skipped four special flights until Indian embassy allowed her to fly with her pet dog. Keerthana reached Chennai airport along with her dog 'Candy' on Saturday. She said, "I waited for extra two-three days. Authorities said I can bring my puppy but I will have to let go of my luggage. I said okay."

4.title: FPIs withdraw record ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4
4.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4 amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. This is almost half of the amount FPIs withdrew in February 2022 at ₹35,506 crore, which was the highest amount withdrawn since March 2020. As per depositories data, they pulled out ₹14,721 crore from equities and ₹2,808 crore from the debt segment.

5.title: It was mentally exhausting to play pregnant cop in 'A Thursday': Neha
5.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said it was physically and mentally exhausting for her to play a pregnant cop in 'A Thursday' under extreme weather conditions. She added the biggest challenge was imposed because of COVID-19 as she was shooting the movie during the pandemic. Neha further said that she believes there is no harm in working while a woman is expecting.

6.title: 3 killed, 36 injured as bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
6.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and 36 others injured after a bus carrying labourers overturned in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Saturday night. The private bus was going to Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow from Kawardha in Chhattisgarh. Eight of the injured people were discharged after treatment at a nearby health centre.

7.title: Himachal gets its 1st-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam
7.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has got its first-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam constructed in Una at a cost of ₹16.38 crore. State Rural Development Minister Virender Kanwar said that the dam will help 5,580 citizens living in water-deficient areas through the dry season. The dam will also help recharge around 44 hand pumps and 31 wells that dry up during drought season.

8.title: Burkina Faso forms interim government after military coup in January
8.article_body: Burkina Faso's transitional President Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba has appointed a new government after a military coup in January this year, according to official decree. The government includes 25 ministers, including Defence Minister General Barthelemy Simpore, who had held same position under previous administration. Burkina Faso's military coup was fourth in West Africa in 18 months.

9.title: OTT lets me work with actors who are hungry, not stars: Tigmanshu
9.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that he enjoys working on OTT platforms because he gets to work with actors who are hungry and not stars. The filmmaker further said that the footprint for OTT content is larger which is the fun part. "Earlier only people in our country...[watched] our work...But now somebody in Africa is seeing my work," Tigmanshu added.

10.title: Men should not look pretty, men should look imperfect: John Abraham
10.article_body: Actor John Abraham in an interview has stated that he believes men should not look pretty, adding that men should look imperfect. The actor further said that fitness is a tripod consisting of good food, good exercise and good sleep. A social media user reacted to John's statement, commenting, "John's statements are problematic but no one says anything to him."

11.title: Working women must choose very carefully when to become mother: Kiran
11.article_body: Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi said working women should "very carefully" choose when to become a mother. "You should not marry unless you are economically independent, or unless someone chooses to be homemaker...it is not imposed decision," she said, adding, "My mother ensured I came back home to warm food, warm bed...clean home...children are taken care of while I worked."

12.title: PM Modi inaugurates 100 new electric buses in Pune
12.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated 100 new electric buses at the Baner depot in Pune. Now, the city has 250 electric buses by Olectra. Another 50 buses are ready to join the fleet by March-end. Earlier in the day, PM Modi also inaugurated the Pune metro rail project and took a ride on a metro train.

13.title: Drone carries blood samples from UP’s Meerut to Noida within 1 hour
13.article_body: A private diagnostic lab in Noida used a drone to transport blood samples from Uttar Pradesh's Meerut to Noida within just one hour. The journey would have taken around 2-3 hours by road, as per reports. The drone belonging to Skye Air Mobility carried blood samples inside a temperature-controlled box and covered a distance of 73.6 km.

14.title: What's a no-fly zone & why was Ukraine's demand for it rejected by NATO?
14.article_body: Declaring a no-fly zone over Ukraine, as per the country's demand, would bar all unauthorised aircraft from flying over it. Western nations imposed such restrictions following the 1991 Gulf War, civil war in Bosnia and Herzegovina etc. NATO rejected Ukraine's demand because it would risk a direct military conflict with Russia by forcing NATO pilots to shoot down Russian aircraft.

15.title: That was a thrashing and in a grand style: Sehwag as India beat Pakistan in Women's WC
15.article_body: Reacting to India defeating Pakistan by 107 runs in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "What a spectacular performance by the Indian girls against Pakistan. That was a thrashing and in grand style." He added, "Pooja Vastrakar with a valiant innings, the ever so reliable Sneh Rana's great all-round show & Rajeshwari Gayakwad outstanding with the ball."

16.title: Happy we won against Pak, but there are a lot of things to work on: Mithali
16.article_body: After defeating Pakistan by 107 runs, India Women captain Mithali Raj said she's happy to have won in their Women's ODI WC opener but there are a lot of things they need to work on. "When you lose wickets in the middle order, it puts a lot of pressure," she added. At one point, India were 114/6  in the match.

17.title: Man driving recklessly stopped & hurled abuses in road rage, claims Kemmu; shares pic
17.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu took to his Instagram Stories to urge Mumbai Police to take action against a driver who Kemmu claimed was driving recklessly. Kemmu said that the driver stopped in front of his car, got out, showed middle finger and hurled abuses. Kemmu called the driver's behaviour "obnoxious and pathetic".

18.title: Sonakshi skipped event after taking ₹37 lakh, non-bailable warrant issued: Reports
18.article_body: A non-bailable warrant has been issued against Sonakshi Sinha in a 2019 fraud case regarding the actress not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance, reports said. According to event organiser Pramod Sharma, from UP's Moradabad, Sinha's manager refused to return the money. Moradabad court has reportedly issued a non-bailable warrant against the actress.

19.title: People are educated in Kerala, won't let us make bad films: Aashiq Abu
19.article_body: Filmmaker Aashiq Abu said that the audience of Kerala won't let filmmakers make bad films. "Every industry has good films and bad films, but in Kerala, people are educated...have access to world cinema. The audiences are very critical and strict there...We can't afford to make a mediocre film...year by year, writers and directors are pushing their limits," he added.

20.title: Zelenskyy invites world's richest man Elon Musk to visit Ukraine; shares video
20.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on a video call with Elon Musk invited the world's richest man to visit Ukraine. "So, If you have time after the war, you are very welcome, I invite you," Zelenskyy told Musk. In a video clip shared by Zelenskyy on Instagram, Musk responded, "That sound's good, I look forward to visiting once things are..."

21.title: Ashwin overtakes Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket
21.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin has become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket. The 35-year-old off-spinner achieved the feat after taking his 435th wicket in Test cricket by dismissing Sri Lanka's Charith Asalanka in their second innings in the first Test in Mohali. Ashwin overtook former India captain Kapil Dev, who had taken 434 wickets in Test cricket.

22.title: Unarmed Ukrainians shout 'go home' as they march towards Russian soldiers
22.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed unarmed civilians marching towards a group of armed Russian soldiers in a street in Ukraine's Melitopol. In the clip, the soldiers can be seen firing in order to disperse the approaching crowd. The locals can also be heard shouting at the soldiers and asking them to "go home".

23.title: Heartbreaking to see places where we shot being bombed: Vishwesh on Ukraine
23.article_body: Filmmaker Vishwesh Krishnamoorthy, who spent time in Ukraine while working on his film '99 Songs', said that it is heartbreaking to see places where they filmed being bombed or destroyed. "I have...friends in Ukraine who were part of crew...It is difficult to read updates from my friends...can't imagine that we are in 2022 and war is real thing," he added.

24.title: Russian hackers are attacking our websites nonstop, says Ukraine
24.article_body: Russian hackers have been attacking Ukrainian websites, including that of the President and the defence ministry, "nonstop" since Russia launched an invasion of the country, Ukraine's cyber watchdog agency said. "The most powerful attacks exceeded 100 Gbps at their peak. Despite all the involved enemy's resources, the sites of...central governmental bodies are available," it added.

25.title: PM Modi inaugurates Pune Metro, pics show him interacting with school students on train
25.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated Pune Metro Rail Project. A tweet from the Prime Minister's Twitter account showed pictures of him interacting with school students on train. It read, "On board the Pune Metro with my young friends." The inaugural event for the 12-km stretch of the total 32.2-km long project took place at the Garware Metro Station.

26.title: Karamyogi of country: Amit Shah on CISF's 53rd Raising Day ceremony
26.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah thanked the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) for being the 'Karamyogi' of the country. "During COVID-19 pandemic when Indians were coming back from abroad, CISF personnel took risks in taking care of fellow Indians and even lost their lives," Shah added. He attended the 53rd Raising Day celebrations of CISF at Indirapuram, Ghaziabad.

27.title: Drunk man kills colleague after fight over repayment of ₹100 loan in Mumbai
27.article_body: A 35-year-old man was bludgeoned to death with a cement block allegedly by his colleague in Mumbai over repayment of ₹100, police said. According to police, the victim, who used to do odd jobs in the locality, had borrowed ₹100 from the accused. "The two were in an inebriated state and had a fight over the loan," an officer said.

28.title: France accused UK of 'lack of humanity' for Ukrainian refugees: AFP
28.article_body: French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin in a letter to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel said that the latter's country's response "lacked humanity" towards Ukrainian refugees, reported AFP. He added that 150 Ukrainian refugees who wanted to join their families in UK were turned away at France's Calais. He also urged the UK to set up a consular presence in Calais.

29.title: Delhi Jal Board to lay 575 km of sewage lines, aims to clean Yamuna
29.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has approved the laying of 575km long sewage lines in unauthorised colonies along with three other projects. DJB chairperson Satyendar Jain said that these lines will carry wastewater from several areas including Sangam Vihar and Sarangpur. The projects, including the installation of an interceptor sewer line at the Barapullah drain, are aimed at cleaning the Yamuna.

30.title: British intelligence services used Grindr to track Russian soldiers: Reports
30.article_body: British intelligence services reportedly monitored the Russian invasion of Ukraine by tracking the soldiers’ use of apps like the gay dating app Grindr and VKontakte, the Russian equivalent for Facebook. The intelligence services gave the information to Ukraine to help them amid the conflict.  Russian President Vladimir Putin had banned Grindr in 2013, but the app is still used discreetly.

31.title: One can stay away from it by focusing on goal: Ajay on dealing with negativity
31.article_body: Ajay Devgn opened up about how he deals with negativity coming his way and said, "You can't change the way people think. It is their prerogative." "One can stay away from negativity by focusing on the goal," he added. Ajay was recently seen in the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and the web show 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness'.

32.title: Mandhana becomes 4th Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs
32.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana scored her 21st half-century against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match to become the fourth Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs. Mithali Raj, Anjum Chopra and Harmanpreet Kaur are the three other Indian women batters who have achieved the feat. Mandhana has now scored 2,513 runs in 65 ODIs.

33.title: Were released only after I called Amit Shah: Union Min Narayan Rane
33.article_body: After being interrogated for nine hours by Mumbai Police on Saturday in connection with Disha Salian's death case, Union Minister Narayan Rane said that he was released after he called Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Rane, whose son Nitesh was also interrogated, said, "Disha Salian did not die by suicide but was murdered. Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar provoked Salian's mother."

34.title: Pune Metro to start on 2 routes today, min fare is ₹10
34.article_body: The Pune Metro trains will be available for the public after 3 pm today. The trains will currently operate on two routes namely Vanaz-Garware College and PCMC-Phugewalu Metro Station. The minimum fare is ₹10 while the maximum is ₹20. From tomorrow, the metro will operate from 8 am to 9 pm at a frequency of 30 minutes.

35.title: We will miss you: Anupam as co-star Parineeti wraps up 'Uunchai' shoot
35.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share that actress Parineeti Chopra has completed shooting for Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "It has been an absolute pleasure working with you #Pari...Stay happy till we meet again! We will MISS you!! Love and prayers always," he wrote. Anupam also shared a video wherein he praised the actress and said that she's full of life.

36.title: Internet services to be suspended in parts of Bengal between March 7 & 16
36.article_body: Mobile internet and broadband services in several regions of West Bengal will be temporarily suspended to prevent unlawful activities, as per an order issued by the state government. The services will remain suspended in a few blocks of Malda, Murshidabad, Uttar Dinajpur, Cooch Behar, Jalpaiguri, Birbhum and Darjeeling between 11 am and 3.15 pm during March 7-9, 11-12 and 14-16.

37.title: He used his points to upgrade me to first class on flight in 1997: Gilchrist on Warne
37.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist said, "His generosity, underestimated by those who didn’t know him, was a strong suit of Warnie's." He added, "I remember flying home with...injury after...Old Trafford Test in 1997 and Warnie was on...same flight because his daughter...was born. We flew home together...He used his points to upgrade me to first class."

38.title: PM Modi unveils 9.5-ft tall statue of Shivaji Maharaj in Pune
38.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled the statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj at the Pune Municipal Corporation on Sunday. The statue, which is about 9.5 feet tall, is made up of 1,850 kg of gunmetal. Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, Leader of Opposition Devendra Fadnavis and Pune Mayor Murlidhar Mohol also attended the event.

39.title: India asks its nationals in Ukraine to give their details on urgent basis, shares form
39.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine has asked all Indian nationals who still remain in Ukraine to give their details to the embassy on an urgent basis for evacuation purposes. It shared a form on Twitter and asked the nationals to fill it up urgently. "Be Safe Be Strong," the embassy wrote. Ukraine-Russia war entered its 11th day today.

40.title: He's turning everything into gold: Sachin on Jadeja's performance vs SL
40.article_body: Former India cricketer Sachin Tendulkar has praised all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for his performance in the ongoing Mohali Test against Sri Lanka. "Jadeja is turning everything into gold, wonderful performance," tweeted Sachin. Jadeja scored 175* during India's first innings and then picked five wickets to help bundle out Sri Lanka for 174 in their first innings.

41.title: Man helps rescue 2 girls after kidnapper boards his e-rickshaw in Delhi
41.article_body: A 40-year-old drug addict was arrested for kidnapping two girls, aged seven and four, after Brahmdutt Rajput, an e-rickshaw driver in Delhi, complained to police about him. Reports said Rajput informed police that a person with two small girls boarded his e-rickshaw from Balaji temple in Vivek Vihar towards Chintamani chowk. Rajput also said behaviour of the accused was "strange".

42.title: Man sends obscene videos to female lawyers, police officers; held in B'luru
42.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 37-year-old man for allegedly harassing female lawyers and police officers by sending obscene videos and messages to them. Police said that at least 14 cases were registered against him and that he had sent messages and videos to around 100 women. The man reportedly went by different names.

43.title: T'gana Guv criticises TRS for not starting session with her address
43.article_body: Telangana Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan on Saturday criticised the TRS-led state government's decision to start the Budget session without her address, saying that it was "unfortunate" that the state government was quoting a "technical reason" to avoid it. She added that by not holding the address, members will lose the opportunity to discuss the state government's previous year performance.

44.title: Constable opens fire inside BSF mess in Punjab, 5 jawans including shooter dead
44.article_body: Five soldiers of the Border Security Force (BSF) lost their lives in a fratricide incident at the BSF mess in Amritsar, Punjab on Sunday. Constable Satteppa SK, who opened fire on his colleagues, was also killed in the incident. One of the injured is critical and a court of inquiry has been ordered to ascertain the facts, said the BSF.

45.title: Arjun wishes Janhvi on 25th b'day, says 'Now you're stuck with me'
45.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to wish her sister-actress, Janhvi Kapoor, on her 25th birthday. Sharing a black and white picture with Janhvi, Arjun wrote, "I know I wasn't around for quite a few birthdays but now you're stuck with me for life." Meanwhile, Janhvi's sister Khushi Kapoor, too, shared a post for her and wrote, "Happy Birthday my everything."

46.title: Hardcore Maoist involved in raising funds & recruiting cadre held in Bihar
46.article_body: A hardcore Maoist, Ramdular Yadav, who was allegedly active in extorting contractors and businessmen and involved in expanding the ultra-base, was arrested in Bihar on Friday, officials said. "Yadav had been active for a decade and was raising funds and recruiting cadres to strengthen the extremist organisation on the Kaimur plateau," Superintendent of Police (SP), Ashish Bharti, said.

47.title: Shah Rukh, Deepika, John Abraham fly to Spain for 'Pathaan' shoot
47.article_body: Actors Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone and John Abraham have reportedly flown to Spain for the shooting of their upcoming film 'Pathaan'. Shah Rukh was spotted at the Mumbai airport on Friday night, while Deepika was seen at the airport in an all-red ensemble on Saturday. The film, directed by Siddharth Anand, is scheduled to release on January 25, 2023.

48.title: He was born for this, I was endlessly impressed: Sean Penn on Ukraine President Zelenskyy
48.article_body: Academy Award-winning actor Sean Penn, who was in Ukraine to film a documentary on Russia-Ukraine conflict, opened up about meeting Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on the day of invasion. “I don’t know if he knew that he was born for this...I was endlessly impressed and moved by him and terrified for him and for Ukraine," he added.

49.title: India defeat Pakistan in Women's World Cup again, extend 100% win record to 4-0
49.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by 107 runs in their first match of 2022 Women's World Cup in Mount Maunganui on Sunday. With this, India extended their 100% winning run against Pakistan in Women's World Cup history to four matches. The match witnessed Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar register the highest seventh-wicket partnership (122 runs) in women's ODI cricket history.

50.title: Will send BBMP chief to jail if he defies waste dumping order: HC
50.article_body: Karnataka High Court on Saturday said that Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta will be sent to jail if he can't follow its order against waste dumping at Mittaganahalli quarry. It also asked Gupta to file an affidavit as to why its order is being disregarded. "We've been watching [Gupta's] conduct...This isn't the first case," it said.

51.title: Even Pakistani student trying to grab Indian flag to escape Ukraine: UP Deputy CM
51.article_body: UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said, "Even a Pakistani student is trying to grab an Indian flag to escape Ukraine." This is not a simple achievement, Maurya added. " I feel proud that in the war between Russia and Ukraine, Indian students are being evacuated safely," Maurya stated.

52.title: Tattoo artist in Kochi arrested after multiple women allege sexual assault
52.article_body: Sujeesh PS, a popular tattoo artist in Kerala's Kochi, was arrested on Saturday night for allegedly sexually assaulting multiple women. So far, Kerala Police has registered at least six cases of sexual assault against him. Police said Sujeesh had been absconding for the last four days after an 18-year-old girl, in a post on social media, claimed she was raped.

53.title: Customer stabs fruit seller to death over money transaction in Mumbai
53.article_body: A customer stabbed a fruit seller to death over money transaction in Mumbai's Null Bazar area on Saturday. "Sohrab Qureshi (25) had dispute with fruit seller over money transaction after which...he stabbed fruit seller Babuji Qureshi (55)...and attacked his son Chhotu Qureshi (30). Babuji died on spot while Chhotu has been admitted to JJ Hospital for treatment," an official said.

54.title: I see a lot more of him in me, he taught me to live life: Shaheer on father
54.article_body: Actor Shaheer Sheikh said that his late father taught him to live life. "No one can fill the space he left behind in my life...Now I see a lot more of him in me...I would want to carry on legacy...keep doing stuff he used to like and used to do," Shaheer said, adding his father lived how he wanted to.

55.title: Ludhiana man accused of abducting assaults & molests victim’s mother
55.article_body: A man who is accused of abducting a youth and thrashing him assaulted the latter’s mother after barging in their house in Ludhiana on Friday, Raikot Police said. According to the woman, the accused tore her clothes and also molested her. The accused man had been forcing her to withdraw the kidnapping case which she had lodged against him.

56.title: Ukraine making nuclear 'Dirty Bomb' in Chernobyl, claims Russia media
56.article_body: Russian media has cited an unnamed source as saying that Ukraine was close to building a plutonium-based "dirty bomb" nuclear weapon without any evidence. The TASS, RIA and Interfax news agencies quoted "a representative of a competent body" in Russia as saying Ukraine was developing nuclear weapons at the destroyed Chernobyl nuclear power plant that was shut down in 2000.

57.title: Ricky Ponting breaks down while paying tribute to Shane Warne, video surfaces
57.article_body: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting broke down while paying tribute to Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 on Friday. "He is going to go down as one of the all-time greats of the game if not the greatest. I have never played with or against a better bowler," he added. He further said Warne revolutionised spin bowling.

58.title: NHRC issues notice to Bihar govt on groundwater contamination in 31 districts
58.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to Bihar government over reports claiming that groundwater in 31 of Bihar's 38 districts is contaminated with arsenic, fluoride and iron, officials said. The NHRC said it has taken suo motu cognisance of a media report quoting the recent Bihar Economic Survey report 2021-22, which was tabled in the Assembly.

59.title: My husband enjoys the love track in Anupamaa; he's my ardent supporter: Rupali
59.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly, who features in 'Anupamaa', said her husband enjoys the love track in the show. "My husband is loving the present romantic track between Anuj Kapadia and Anupamaa. We both watch the show together. He's my biggest critic as well as my biggest supporter." "He catches...little nuances and tells me that I could've done this better," she added.

60.title: Rohit would've definitely communicated with Jadeja: Jaffer on India's 1st innings
60.article_body: Reacting to captain Rohit Sharma's criticism on social media for declaring India's first innings at 574/8 when Ravindra Jadeja was batting at 175, Wasim Jaffer said it's not possible that players didn't know when they would declare. "Rohit would've definitely communicated with Jadeja...To make 25 runs, you definitely need 30-45 minutes. So...maybe they declared early," Jaffer added.

61.title: I love Shawn, we're learning to be healthy adults: Camila on breakup
61.article_body: Songwriter-singer Camila Cabello said she has nothing but love for her ex-boyfriend and songwriter-singer Shawn Mendes. "I love Shawn...And I feel like there is literally nothing but love for him," she said, adding, "We both started so young too, we're really learning how to be healthy adults. And that sometimes means not having your number one focus be career."

62.title: President Kovind flags off fitness run at Rashtrapati Bhavan
62.article_body: As a part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' celebrations, President Ram Nath Kovind and First Lady Savita Kovind flagged off a fitness run at the Rashtrapati Bhavan in New Delhi on Sunday. "Along with the President, senior officials and staff of the President's Secretariat participated in the run," the President of India tweeted.

63.title: TN court convicts 10 people in 2015 Dalit man beheading case
63.article_body: A court in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has convicted 10 of the 17 accused of killing a 21-year-old Dalit man whose headless body was found on railway tracks in 2015. The accused, who belong to the Gounder community, had allegedly killed the deceased on seeing him talking to a girl from their community. The prime accused is a caste-centric outfit's leader.

64.title: Eco Mitra Park with artworks made from tyres, bottles opened in Delhi
64.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) has started an Eco Mitra Park in Delhi's Sarita Vihar. "Through the initiative, SDMC has been promoting the principle of 3Rs which is reduce, reuse and recycle as beautiful artworks have been made from old tyres, bottles, unused items at this park," an SDMC official said, adding park aims at making people aware.

65.title: Sophie Turner, Joe Jonas expecting their second child: Reports
65.article_body: Actress Sophie Turner and her husband, singer Joe Jonas, are expecting their second child together, according to reports. The couple had welcomed their first child, Willa, two years ago. "They both have siblings and didn't want their daughter to be an only child. The couple recently celebrated Sophie's birthday, as well as the pregnancy," a source told ET.

66.title: Kerala restaurant takes 'Russian Salad' off its menu in solidarity with Ukraine
66.article_body: A restaurant in Kerala's Fort Kochi named Kashi Art Cafe has put up a noticeboard in front of the restaurant reading, "In solidarity with the people of Ukraine, we have removed 'RUSSIAN SALAD' from our menu." The restaurant owner said the gesture was meant to condemn the attack being carried out by Russia on the innocent people of Ukraine.

67.title: B.Tech graduate arrested for snatching 64-yr-old woman's purse in Chandigarh
67.article_body: A 25-year-old B.Tech graduate from Himachal Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly snatching the purse of a 64-year-old woman in a market in Chandigarh. The victim reportedly received a fracture in one arm after she fell while chasing him. "The accused is a drug addict. He snatched the purse to get the money to buy drugs," a police officer said.

68.title: Sathyaraj is my lucky mascot: 'Baahubali', 'Mirchi' co-star Prabhas
68.article_body: Prabhas has said veteran actor Sathyaraj is his "lucky mascot". "I worked with him in 'Mirchi' which was a super hit and then 'Baahubali', a blockbuster hit," he added. Prabhas, who will be seen alongside Sathyaraj in the upcoming film 'Radhe Shyam', further said, "I am confident that 'Radhe Shyam' is going to be yet another milestone in our career."

69.title: We had never heard of 'flipper', and then Warne used it to set us up with it: Nasser
69.article_body: Ex-England captain Nasser Hussain has said Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, was arguably the greatest cricketer. "There was never a dull moment when Warne had the ball," he added. "Leg spin was a dying art before Warne; we had never heard of a 'flipper', and then suddenly he used to set us up with it," Nasser recalled.

70.title: Mithali Raj becomes first-ever woman cricketer to feature in 6 ODI World Cups
70.article_body: By featuring in India's 2022 Women's World Cup opener against Pakistan, captain Mithali Raj became the first-ever woman cricketer to feature in six ODI World Cups. Mithali made her ODI World Cup debut in 2000 and also played in 2005, 2009, 2013 and 2017 editions. Among male cricketers, only Javed Miandad and Sachin Tendulkar have featured in six World Cups.

71.title: Mayank, Sanah decided their own wedding rituals & decor: Seema Pahwa
71.article_body: Actress Seema Pahwa said her son Mayank Pahwa and Sanah Kapur's wedding was kept an intimate affair because of the pandemic. She added that the rituals in their wedding weren't specific to any one type and the couple came up with their own set of rituals. Seema further revealed that the decor was also decided by Mayank and Sanah.

72.title: Minor girls playing after school killed as speeding truck hits them in Maha
72.article_body: Two girls, aged five and nine, were killed after a speeding truck hit them in Maharashtra's Palghar district on Saturday. Police said that the girls were playing after school when the incident took place. An official said that the truck also hit a tree and caught fire and that the driver was caught when he attempted to run away.

73.title: Ravindra Jadeja takes 5 wickets after scoring 175* as India bowl Sri Lanka out for 174
73.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja took his 10th five-wicket haul in Test cricket as India bowled Sri Lanka out for 174 runs in 65 overs in their first innings in the first Test in Mohali. Jadeja registered bowling figures of 13-4-41-5 after having scored his Test career-best score of 175*(228). India have enforced follow-on after taking first-innings lead of 400.

74.title: Walked around with story in head for yrs, saw my Gangubai in Alia: Bhansali
74.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said that he walked around with Gangubai's story in his head for many years. "Many thought I was making a mistake in casting Alia in Gangubai Kathiawadi, that she was too petite for the role. But I saw my Gangubai in Alia. And she gave her all, and then some more to the role," he added.

75.title: US senators share pics of Zelenskyy after being 'asked not to'; criticised
75.article_body: US Representative Dean Phillips on Saturday criticised two US senators for sharing pictures of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, saying that it was "reckless" and that the Ukrainian Ambassador had "asked each of us on [zoom call] to not share anything on social media". While Zelenskyy himself shared pictures of the zoom call later, his live location is being kept secret.

76.title: Ukrainian statehood at risk, Western sanctions akin to declaring war: Putin
76.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin continued to blame Ukrainian leadership for the war and slammed their resistance to the invasion. "If they continue to do what they are doing, they are calling into question the future of Ukrainian statehood," he said. Putin also hit out at Western sanctions, saying, "These sanctions that are being imposed, they are akin to declaring war."

77.title: As captain or coach, you don't think too much about individual glory: Karthik
77.article_body: Supporting India's decision to declare their innings at 574/8 with Ravindra Jadeja batting on 175, Dinesh Karthik said the management takes the call considering how much is left before stumps. "When you are on 195-196, then you think twice. Other than that, as a captain or coach, you're not thinking too much about individual glory," he added.

78.title: Inter-state child trafficking racket busted in Ahmedabad, 9 held for abducting infant
78.article_body: Police in Ahmedabad busted an inter-state child trafficking racket and nine people were arrested for their alleged involvement in the kidnapping of a four-month-old infant girl. The abducted infant was allegedly sold off to couples. The infant was sold to agents twice, first in Vadodara and then in Hyderabad for ₹2 lakh before being retrieved by the police in Surat.

79.title: SP, BJP fought UP polls on issues similar to Congress: Bhupesh Baghel
79.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said that Samajwadi Party (SP) and BJP fought UP elections on issues similar to Congress. His statement came hours after campaigning for the seventh and final phase of the UP Assembly elections concluded on Saturday. "For the first time, SP, BJP had to leave their issues and come to our issues," Baghel added.

80.title: Aamir has a big heart, he calls new directors & watches their films: Nagraj
80.article_body: Filmmaker Nagraj Manjule, whose 'Jhund' starring Amitabh Bachchan recently released in theatres, has said Aamir Khan has a big heart as he calls new directors and watches their films and appreciates them. "For 'Jhund', he took out a lot of time, saw it, and discussed it with us the whole night," Nagraj said, adding, "His opinion is important to me."

81.title: Shane Warne had just finished 'ridiculous' 14-day diet: Manager on ex-cricketer's demise
81.article_body: Late Australian spin legend Shane Warne's manager James Erskine has revealed that Warne had finished a "ridiculous" 14-day diet before his death. "He did go on these ridiculous sorts of diets...where he basically only ate fluids for 14 days and he’d done this three or four times," Erskine said. He further said that Warne suffered a "massive heart attack".

82.title: Kiara shares pictures from her sister Ishita Advani's wedding
82.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, actress Kiara Advani shared pictures from her sister Ishita Advani's wedding. In one of the pictures, Kiara was seen performing the bridesmaid's duties as Ishita got ready for her wedding. Kiara was seen marking with kohl on her sister's neck. Alongside the photo, Kiara wrote, "Nazar na lage (Let no one's evil eye be on you)."

83.title: Hoardings criticising PM Modi removed ahead of his visit to Pune
83.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to Pune, the Nuisance Prevention Squad of Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) has removed the 'Go Back Modi' hoardings put up by Congress city unit on Saturday. The hoardings sponsored by the BJP were left up. Congress leader Mohan Joshi condemned the action and said that black flags will be waved during the PM's visit.

84.title: Nearly 205 tortoises seized from toilet of Delhi-bound train in Bihar
84.article_body: Nearly 205 tortoises, including those of an endangered species, were seized from a Delhi-bound train at Narkatiaganj railway station in Bihar's West Champaran district, officials said. The tortoises were found concealed inside four pillow covers in a toilet on the Satyagraha Express, Narkatiaganj SHO said. "We have handed over the tortoises to the wildlife authorities," the SHO added.

85.title: Stay inside, avoid unnecessary risks: Govt after students' viral video from Ukraine
85.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs said it is concerned about Indian students in Sumy, Ukraine after a video went viral in which the students said that they were risking their lives and moving towards the border. The ministry said, "Have advised our students to take safety precautions, stay inside shelters and avoid unnecessary risks."

86.title: Unjust: TN Min as K'taka allocates ₹1,000 cr for Mekedatu project
86.article_body: Tamil Nadu Water Resources Minister Duraimurugan on Saturday criticised the Karnataka government for allocating ₹1,000 crore for Mekedatu project in its Budget, saying that it is "unjust" as it hadn't taken the concurrence of riparian states for building the reservoir across river Cauvery. He added that the project went against the principles of federalism and a Supreme Court judgement.

87.title: Puducherry's iconic Rock Beach pier partially collapses due to high waves
87.article_body: Puducherry's iconic pier at Rock Beach collapsed partially because of high waves caused by a deep depression over the Bay of Bengal on Saturday night. Meanwhile, India Meteorological Department has predicted light to moderate rainfall/thundershower at a few places with heavy rainfall at isolated places over north coastal Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Karaikal on March 6.

88.title: Error found in Maha HSC Class 12 exam paper; students to get 1 mark each
88.article_body: An erroneous question was found printed in the English language paper of Class 12 Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) examination. Following this, the Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has announced that it will grant one mark to every student who attempted the question. Approximately 14 lakh students across Maharashtra took the exam on March 4.

89.title: Chelsea beat Burnley 4-0, Aston Villa beat Southampton 4-0 in PL
89.article_body: Germany's Kai Havertz scored twice on Saturday as Chelsea beat Burnley 4-0 in the Premier League, while Aston Villa beat Southampton 4-0. Elsewhere, Ivan Toney scored a hat-trick as Brentford beat Norwich City 3-1 and Newcastle United beat Brighton 2-1. Leicester City beat Leeds United 1-0 and Crystal Palace beat Wolves 2-0. Manchester City faces Manchester United on Sunday.

90.title: Sneh-Pooja's record partnership helps India set Pakistan 245-run target in Women's WC
90.article_body: India have set a target of 245 for Pakistan to chase in their first 2022 Women's World Cup match. India, who were 114-6 after 33.1 overs, managed to put up a total of 244/7. Sneh Rana and Pooja Vastrakar shared a partnership of 122 runs, which is the highest seventh-wicket partnership in women's ODI cricket history.

91.title: Ghaziabad's industries to file plea against conversion to PNG fuel
91.article_body: Unsatisfied with the state pollution control board's notice to mandatory convert to Piped Natural Gas (PNG) or biomass fuel supply by September 30, several industrial units have decided to file representations with the UP government. Notably, the order was issued to "390 air polluting industrial units" in the Ghaziabad district on directions of the Commission for Air Quality Management.

92.title: My cats are my life, could not leave them behind: Ukraine returnee
92.article_body: An Indian student who returned from Ukraine said that he could not leave his pet cats behind. "Indian embassy helped...me in bringing back...my pets with me. My cats are my life...I request everyone to bring back...pets with them," he said. Earlier, another student had refused to leave Ukraine after being unable to get NOC from government to bring his dog.

93.title: Ludhiana woman found hanging at home, husband & in-laws booked for abetting suicide
93.article_body: A 35-year-old woman was found hanging in Ludhiana’s Dhillon Nagar on Friday, when she was alone at home. Her father has alleged that she was harassed by her husband and in-laws, who used to accuse her of not performing daily chores properly. Police have booked her husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law for abetting her suicide.

94.title: Me & my family were mercilessly trolled, we were in shock: Majumdar on Saha controversy
94.article_body: While revealing that his lawyers will be serving Wriddhiman Saha a defamation notice over the WhatsApp chat controversy, journalist Boria Majumdar said, "As a result of what Saha did, me and my family...were mercilessly trolled." He added, "[People heaped] abuse on them for days on end...It was very difficult for me to take that. We were all in shock."

95.title: Felt embarrassed, wouldn't do it today: Jamie on filming nude scene
95.article_body: Actress Jamie Lee Curtis said in an interview that she felt embarrassed doing the nude scene in the 1983 film 'Trading Places'. "Did I like doing it? No...Did I know what I was doing? Yeah...Was I doing it because it was the job? Yes," she added. The 63-year-old actress further said she "would absolutely not" appear naked on screen today.

96.title: I personally feel I let the team down during Ashes 2021-22: Ben Stokes
96.article_body: England all-rounder Ben Stokes has said he let a lot of people down during their 0-4 defeat in Ashes 2021-22. "I let the team down with more than just performances, I would have liked to have been in better physical shape," he added. Stokes scored a total of 236 runs and picked just four wickets in five Tests.

97.title: Putin must fail: UK PM Boris as he sets out action plan for Ukraine
97.article_body: UK PM Boris Johnson is set to launch a six-point action plan in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, his office said on Saturday. "[Russian President Vladimir Putin] must fail and must be seen to fail in this act of aggression," Johnson said. The objectives of the plan include an international humanitarian coalition for Ukraine and economic pressure on Moscow.

98.title: Ukraine shares pic of woman carrying rifle while walking with child, says 'Wonder Woman'
98.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a picture of a woman carrying a rifle while walking with a child on a street amid war in Ukraine and termed her a 'Wonder Woman'. "Every Ukrainian mother deserves to be called a Wonder Woman," the tweet read. Russia-Ukraine war entered its 11th day today.

99.title: India reports 5,476 new COVID-19 cases and 158 deaths
99.article_body: India has recorded 5,476 new COVID-19 cases and 158 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 5,921 cases and 289 deaths. India's active caseload stands at 59,442, while the death toll in the country has reached 5,15,036.

100.title: Pic of fan's poster reading 'I won't get married until Virat scores his 71st' goes viral
100.article_body: A picture of a fan carrying a poster dedicated to Virat Kohli at the IS Bindra Punjab Cricket Association in Mohali has gone viral. The poster reads, "I will not get married until Virat scores his 71st." Kohli, who has hit 70 international hundreds, last scored an international ton in November 2019.

101.title: UP's future safe in Akhilesh Yadav's hands, says Mayank Joshi after joining SP
101.article_body: BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi's son, Mayank Joshi, who joined the Samajwadi Party (SP) on Saturday said that UP's future will be safe in former CM Akhilesh Yadav's hands. "Akhilesh Yadav talks about development, women's safety and youth. As a youth, I thought to stand with such a person who talks progressively," Mayank added.

102.title: 230 passengers stranded in Gurez valley due to bad weather airlifted
102.article_body: As many as 230 stranded passengers were airlifted to and fro Gurez valley in J&K’s Bandipora on Saturday. "The passengers were stranded due to bad weather," Deputy Commissioner, Bandipora, Owais Ahmad, said. There were 84 candidates among the passengers who were expected to appear in the J&K Services Selection Board (JKSSB) examination on Sunday.

103.title: Union Minister, son questioned for over 8 hrs in Disha Salian defamation case
103.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane and his son MLA Nitesh Rane were questioned at Malvani police station in Mumbai for over eight hours on Saturday. The interrogation was regarding a case registered against them for allegedly making defamatory statements about the death of Disha Salian, late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's former manager. Salian allegedly died by suicide on June 8, 2020.

104.title: I followed RR religiously due to presence of Shane Warne: Chahal
104.article_body: Paying his tribute to Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal said the ex-Australia spinner was his idol. "Till the time I didn't join IPL, the first three years, I followed Rajasthan Royals religiously and I watched every single match because of Warne," revealed Chahal. Warne played 55 matches for the RR between 2008 and 2011.

105.title: Dealer steals car days after selling it in Punjab, manhunt launched
105.article_body: A car dealer and his aide stole a car that the dealer had sold off to a man in Punjab's Ludhiana. Reports said that ₹1.7 lakh and other documents were kept in the car. Police said that accused said they would return the car and documents but did not turn up. Police has launched a manhunt to catch the accused.

106.title: Call on India to appeal to Russia to stop fire and allow civilians to leave: Ukraine
106.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has called on the governments of India, China and Nigeria to appeal to Russia to stop the fire and allow civilians to leave. Kuleba claimed that humanitarian corridors and ceasefires don't exist because Russian forces violated the agreement to arrange humanitarian corridors. Notably, around 13,300 people returned to India from Ukraine under Operation Ganga.

107.title: Sidharth always wanted to see me happy: Shehnaaz Gill
107.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty on Saturday shared the trailer of her upcoming chat show, 'Shape of You'. The trailer features several celebrities, including 'Bigg Boss 13' fame Shehnaaz Gill. In the trailer, Shehnaaz can also be seen talking about her friend, late-actor Sidharth Shukla. Shehnaaz said, "Sidharth mujhe hamesha haste hue dekhna chahta tha. (Sidharth always wanted to see me happy)."

108.title: 'Dark Shadows', 'Lethal Weapon' actor Mitchell Ryan passes away at 88
108.article_body: 'Dark Shadows' actor Mitchell Ryan passed away on Friday at the age of 88. He died of congestive heart failure at his home in Los Angeles, his stepdaughter Denise Freed told The Hollywood Reporter. Mitchell was known for his work in 'Dharma & Greg' and movies including 'Lethal Weapon', 'Liar Liar' and 'Halloween: The Curse of Michael Myers'.

109.title: It took me 30 years to understand I am trans: Sushant Divgikr
109.article_body: Trans actor Sushant Divgikr said that it took them 30 years to understand they were trans. "I don't expect everyone to understand everything...but respect us even from distance. Just respect us," Sushant said, adding, "Now, I am gender-fluid, trans person. I have both the energies in me." "Everybody thinks we are standing on streets and selling our bodies," Sushant added.

110.title: Family attacked by neighbours for objecting to buffaloes kept on road in Delhi
110.article_body: Six people, including five members of a family, were injured after they were attacked with iron rods, sticks and concrete bricks allegedly by nearly 20 people belonging to another family in the neighbourhood in Delhi's New Ashok Nagar. The clash took place after an argument broke out between the two families over keeping buffaloes on road, near the victims' house.

111.title: Domestic help steals cash, jewellery worth ₹9 lakh in Pune; 2 held
111.article_body: A domestic help and her husband have been arrested after she allegedly stole cash and jewellery worth over ₹9 lakh from her employer's house in Pune. The accused couple had initially gone absconding after an FIR was filed against them. The domestic help claimed she did so to take "revenge" because her employer didn't give her salary on time.

112.title: Boria Majumdar accuses Saha of tampering screenshot of WhatsApp chat, shares pics
112.article_body: Days after cricketer Wriddhiman Saha shared a screenshot of a WhatsApp chat alleging that a journalist threatened him, journalist Boria Majumdar accused Saha of tampering screenshot of their WhatsApp chat. He added that it has damaged his reputation and credibility. Majumdar further said that he didn't threaten Saha and stated that his lawyers are serving a defamation notice to Saha.

113.title: Large amount of blood found in Shane Warne's room after CPR, says Thai police
113.article_body: Police in Thailand said that a large amount of blood was found in Shane Warne's room at a villa in Thailand. "When CPR was started...the deceased had coughed up liquid and was bleeding," the police added. Various reports claim blood stains were seen on the carpet and on three towels and a pillow. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.

114.title: B'luru records less than 300 new COVID-19 cases for 7 days in a row
114.article_body: Bengaluru has recorded less than 300 new coronavirus cases for seven days in a row with 182 new cases on Saturday, according to official data. The positivity rate in the city was lowest on March 2 at 0.69, the same day Bengaluru also recorded the lowest number of new cases at 106 in the past seven days, the data shows.

115.title: Jadeja is becoming the genuine all-rounder we talk about: Gambhir
115.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja's unbeaten 175-run innings during India's first innings in the ongoing Mohali Test, Gautam Gambhir said the 33-year-old is becoming a "genuine all-rounder". "The way Jadeja has contributed with the bat, whether it was England, Australia or now India, it's a great sign for Indian cricket," Gambhir stated. Jadeja has also picked 232 wickets in 57 Tests.

116.title: BSF seizes over 400 kg human hair being smuggled into Bangladesh in 1 yr
116.article_body: Border Security Force has seized more than 400 kilos of human hair while they were being smuggled into Bangladesh over the past one year. "First consignment, of around 12 kilos was intercepted in Nadia district in February 2021...At least 397 kilos of human hair were seized in 2021...while around 47 kilos have been seized so far...this year," BSF official said.

117.title: Countries with relations with India can urge PM Modi to ask Putin to stop war: Ukraine
117.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said that all the countries that enjoy special relations with India can appeal to PM Narendra Modi to continue reaching out to Russian President Vladimir Putin and explaining that this war is against the interest of all. He added, "Ordinary Indians can put pressure on Russian Embassy in India to stop the war."

118.title: Police find woman on Hyd road; call ambulance, arrange food; share pic
118.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share picture of a woman. Police said woman was found on Chintalakunta road and was suffering from stomach pain. The post by police also said that ambulance was called, after which, the woman's health was checked. Food was also arranged for her. "Shifted her to Aleti Ashramam. She is speaking different languages," police wrote.

119.title: Mumbai man jailed for removing shirt, making lewd gestures before women police
119.article_body: A magistrate court has sentenced a man to ten days in jail and imposed a fine of ₹500 for removing his shirt and making lewd gestures before women police personnel at Mumbai's Dadar police station in 2016. The man was among two persons who were taken to the police station as the duo was shouting and fighting under Keshavsut flyover.

120.title: Hyd man climbs electric pole after cart gets stolen, police share video
120.article_body: A vendor whose pushcart was allegedly stolen climbed an electric pole in Hyderabad's Amberpet on Saturday. The man alleged someone had stolen his cart and demanded for it to be returned to him or he would end his life. Reports said local residents informed police about the incident. The police promised him justice, after which he stepped down from pole.

121.title: Was crying for 40 days after giving birth: Mandira on postpartum depression
121.article_body: Actress Mandira Bedi said she was crying for first 40 days after giving birth. "I could not understand. Your hormones have taken toss. You have taken human being out of you. So, that's what postpartum depression is. It's hormonal imbalance," she said, adding, "On 41st day in the pouring rain, I went to exercise...I was miraculously feeling much better emotionally."

122.title: 62-yr-old retired Army man jumps off 18th-floor balcony in Gurugram, dies
122.article_body: A 62-year-old retired Army man allegedly died by suicide after jumping off the 18th-floor balcony of his daughter's apartment in Gurugram on Saturday, police said. The man, a resident of Delhi, had reportedly come to his daughter's apartment around five days ago with his wife. His family claimed he was mentally disturbed, police said, adding that they're investigating the case.

123.title: Data-stealing 'TeaBot' malware found in Google Play: Researchers
123.article_body: An Android malware called 'TeaBot', designed to steal user data like passwords and text messages, was found in Google Play and downloaded thousands of times, researchers at Cleafy said. They noted that the malicious 'QR Code & Barcode – Scanner' app appeared legitimate and well-functioning. However, it was acting as a dropper to deliver 'TeaBot' through a fake in-app update.

124.title: India to bat first against Pakistan in 2022 Women's World Cup, playing XI announced
124.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj won the toss and elected to bat first against Pakistan in their first 2022 Women's World Cup match at Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. Smriti Mandhana and Shafali Verma will open for India. India's playing XI also includes Pooja Vastrakar, Meghna Singh and Rajeshwari Gayakwad. India have never lost against Pakistan in Women's World Cup history.

125.title: Israeli PM meets Putin in Moscow to discuss Russia-Ukraine conflict
125.article_body: Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on Saturday to discuss the conflict in Ukraine, an official Israeli statement said. "The meeting lasted for about two and a half hours," it added. Notably, Israel, a close ally of the United States, has condemned the Russian invasion and sent humanitarian aid to Ukraine.

126.title: Nawab Malik being linked to Dawood as he's muslim: Sharad Pawar
126.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Saturday said Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's arrest in an alleged money laundering case was "politically motivated". He added that Malik was being linked to the underworld don Dawood Ibrahim "because he's a Muslim". Dismissing BJP's demands for Malik's resignation, Pawar said, "PM Modi should explain why Narayan Rane didn't resign when he was arrested".

127.title: Kamala Harris to visit Romania, Poland amid Ukraine-Russia conflict
127.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris will visit Poland and Romania from March 9 to 11 amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Harris' "meetings will...focus on how the US can further support Ukraine's neighbours as they welcome and care for refugees fleeing violence", her office said. Notably, Harris had visited Europe last month to attend the Munich Security Conference.

128.title: G7 foreign ministers condemn Russian attack on Ukrainian civilians
128.article_body: G7 foreign ministers on Friday said they were "deeply concerned with the catastrophic humanitarian toll taken by Russia's continuing strikes" against Ukrainian civilians. "We re-emphasize that indiscriminate attacks are prohibited by international humanitarian law. We will hold accountable those responsible for war crimes, including indiscriminate use of weapons against civilians," they added.

129.title: He brought such joy to the game: Mick Jagger on Shane Warne
129.article_body: Mick Jagger, vocalist of the English rock band The Rolling Stones, condoled the death of former Australian cricketer Shane Warne, saying, "I'm so saddened by the sudden death of Shane Warne. He brought such joy to the game and was the greatest spin bowler ever." Warne died aged 52 on Friday of a suspected heart attack in Thailand.

130.title: Thousands of Ladakhis protest attack on Shia mosque in Pakistan
130.article_body: Thousands of people took part in a protest in Ladakh's Kargil on Saturday against the bombing of a Shia mosque in Pakistan. Raising slogans against Pakistan over its alleged failure in protecting the minorities, the protesters marched through the Shia-dominated main town and later staged a sit-in. Around 62 worshippers had died in the blast.

131.title: Khattar launches portal for giving monetary help on medical grounds
131.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Saturday launched a portal for those seeking financial assistance on medical grounds under the Chief Minister's Relief Fund. Khattar said that after re-examining the earlier process, directions were given to digitise it through the SARAL portal. The amount shall be transferred directly to the account of the applicant or beneficiary.

132.title: We had posters of him on the wall: Pat Cummins on Shane Warne
132.article_body: Reacting to Shane Warne's demise, Pat Cummins said, "He was an all-time great and a once-in-a-century kind cricketer. His records will live on forever." Cummins added, "We had posters of him on the wall. We love...his showmanship, his charisma, his tactics, the way he helped Australia win so many games and above everything else he was an incredibly skilled leg-spinner."

133.title: CCI dismisses predatory pricing claims against e-commerce firm Shopee
133.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has dismissed allegations of predatory pricing levelled against the e-commerce platform Shopee. In its order, CCI said that Shopee did not hold a significant market power as it is a new entrant. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) had claimed that Shopee sold various products at low prices and indulged in predatory pricing.

134.title: Federer unlikely to play Wimbledon says coach Severin Luthi: Reports
134.article_body: Roger Federer's coach Severin Luthi reportedly said it is unlikely the 20-time Grand Slam champion will play this year's Wimbledon as he continues to recover from knee surgery. "I'm not someone who is saying it's impossible. But I can't imagine it right now," Luthi said. Federer, 40, announced last year he will undergo his third knee surgery in two years.

135.title: BJP dissolves 8 district units in Tamil Nadu
135.article_body: The BJP on Saturday dissolved eight district units in Tamil Nadu as part of its efforts to strengthen the party organisation. BJP's Tamil Nadu chief K Annamalai also named eight interim office-bearers to oversee party work in these districts. Party spokesperson Narayanan Thirupathy said the move was not related to performance of BJP functionaries in recently concluded urban civic polls.

136.title: Advanced Brahmos missile shows pin-point destruction of target, video released
136.article_body: The Indian Navy on Saturday successfully test-fired an advanced version of the BrahMos cruise missile with long-range precision strike capability. "Pin-point destruction of target demonstrated combat and mission readiness of frontline platforms," said the Indian Navy, sharing a video of the test. "Yet another shot in the arm for Aatmanirbhar Bharat," said the Navy.

137.title: 97-yr-old Stanislavskyi, world's oldest tennis player, to stay in Ukraine amid war
137.article_body: Leonid Stanislavskyi, who holds the Guinness World Record for being the world's oldest tennis player, said he'll stay in Ukraine despite the ongoing war with Russia. "I hope I live to reach 100. I have to survive this frightening situation," the 97-year-old said. "I'm hoping that the war will end and I will be able to play tennis," he added.

138.title: Russia, Belarus suspended from Council of Baltic Sea States: EU
138.article_body: The European Union on Saturday said it joined other members of the Council of the Baltic Sea States (CBSS) in suspending Russia and Belarus from its activities. "This decision is a part of the European Union's and like-minded partners response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine and the involvement of Belarus in this unprovoked and unjustified aggression," it said.

139.title: Get your petrol tanks full, election offer on fuel ending: Rahul
139.article_body: Ahead of the final phase of polling in Uttar Pradesh, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday criticised the Centre over rising fuel prices. "Get your petrol tanks full immediately. (PM Narendra) Modi-led government's 'election' offer is going to end," he tweeted. Earlier on Friday, Rahul had accused the BJP of seeking votes on the "basis of lies".

140.title: 19-year-old woman hangs self in Punjab's Mohali, friend booked
140.article_body: A 19-year-old woman hanged herself at her house at Amb Sahib Colony in Punjab's Mohali on Friday. Her friend Vishal has been booked for abetment to suicide. The victim's mother said her daughter had been upset after falling out with Vishal. "The body has been kept at the Phase-6 Civil Hospital for autopsy," said Gagandeep Singh, SHO, Phase 11, Mohali.

141.title: Russian air, artillery strikes in Ukraine lessen in past 24 hours: UK
141.article_body: British defence ministry on Saturday said the rate of Russian air and artillery strikes was lower in past 24 hours as compared to the previous days. "Ukraine continues to hold the key cities of Kharkiv, Chernihiv and Mariupol," added the ministry. The intelligence update by British officials also stated Russian forces were probably advancing towards southern port city of Mykolaiv.

142.title: Indian doctor stays behind in Ukraine to help students, says 'I'm not stuck here'
142.article_body: A 37-year-old doctor and student consultant from Kolkata, Dr Prithwi Raj Ghosh, has decided not to leave Ukraine and stay behind to help in the evacuation of Indian students. "I am not stuck here in Kyiv, I am not leaving by choice. I have evacuated almost 350 students from Ukraine. They were my students in Kyiv," he told India Today.

143.title: Jadeja clarifies India declaring with him on 175*, says 'I sent a message to Rohit'
143.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has clarified India declaring at 574/8 with him on 175*, saying, "I sent a message [to Rohit Sharma] that there is something on offer from...pitch." He added, "I suggested we should put Sri Lanka in to bat [at that time]." He further said, "The plan was to declare quickly and exploit the fatigue of the opposition batters."

144.title: Attack on nuclear power plant is a war crime: US Embassy in Ukraine
144.article_body: The US Embassy in Ukraine said attacking a nuclear power plant is a war crime following Russia's attack and seizure of the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "It is a war crime to attack a nuclear power plant. Putin's shelling of Europe's largest nuclear plant takes his reign of terror one step further," the embassy said.

145.title: Turkey’s President Erdogan to speak with Russia's Putin: Spokesman
145.article_body: Spokesman Ibrahim Kalin on Saturday said Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan will speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday to discuss Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We are focusing on what steps we can take here to bring the sides to the negotiating table and to convince the Russian side (to stop)," Kalin said.

146.title: Srinagar's Jamia Masjid opens for public after 30 weeks
146.article_body: Thousands of devotees turned up to offer Friday prayers at the Jamia Masjid in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar as it opened for public after a gap of 30 weeks. The mosque had closed last April due to the COVID-19 pandemic. "We pray to Almighty that this place should always remain open," said Mehraj ud din, a local resident.

147.title: Russia arrests US' Olympic basketball champion, says she had 'vapes' in luggage
147.article_body: Russia on Saturday said it has arrested US' two-time Olympic basketball champion Brittney Griner on narcotics charges. Russian Federal Customs Service said that an inspection of her hand luggage after she arrived on a flight from US in February "confirmed the presence of 'vapes' (and) a liquid with a specific smell". USA Basketball said they're closely monitoring the legal situation.

148.title: Britain urges citizens to leave Russia following invasion of Ukraine
148.article_body: Britain on Saturday urged its citizens to leave Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. "If your presence in Russia is not essential, we strongly advise that you consider leaving by remaining commercial routes," the British Foreign Office said. It added that flying directly may not be possible, but said flights via Turkey and the Middle East were available.

149.title: Man who jumped parole 35 yrs ago arrested from his home in Gujarat
149.article_body: A murder convict, who was allegedly on the run for 35 years after jumping parole, was arrested by the Gujarat Anti Terrorist Squad (ATS) on Saturday. An ATS official said they deployed a team outside Devendra Dhanani's Rajkot residence after receiving a tip-off that he had returned during the pandemic. Dhanani was arrested along with his brother in 1984.

150.title: Russia vows to impose tough sanctions against UK interests in Russia
150.article_body: Russian foreign ministry on Thursday vowed to impose tough but proportionate measures that would "undoubtedly undermine" British interests in Russia. Russian government said Britain chose to move towards an open confrontation with Russia leaving it with no choice but to enforce stringent measures. UK PM imposed the largest-ever sanctions against Russia following invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

151.title: New US Ambassador reaches Beijing amid tense US-China relations
151.article_body: The US embassy on Saturday said the new US Ambassador Nicholas Burns on Friday reached Beijing, amid tense relations between US and China over Taiwan, human rights and the war in Ukraine. Relations remain tense following the US-led diplomatic boycott of the Beijing Winter Olympics in protest over human rights violations and China's diplomatic support of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

152.title: BJP will bring better-than-expected results in Punjab: JP Nadda
152.article_body: BJP president JP Nadda, on Saturday, while speaking about the party's performance in Punjab, said they received a very positive response from the people. Nadda, who was addressing a joint press conference with Home Minister Amit Shah, added that the party had for the first time fought on over 65 seats in the state and "will bring better-than-expected results there".

153.title: State govt gave 5 lakh jobs to youth in 5 years in UP: CM Yogi
153.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath, while addressing a rally in UP's Sonbhadra on Saturday, said his government provided 5 lakh jobs in the last five years. He added that their policies also created self-employment opportunities for around two crore youngsters in the state. He earlier said his government was planning to provide employment to at least one member of each family.

154.title: Record tourist footfall in J&K, stone-pelting reduced: Army
154.article_body: The Indian Army's Chinar Corps on Saturday said that there has been a reduction in incidents of stone-pelting, protests and bandhs in Jammu & Kashmir, adding that the number of tourists has also increased. "A record number of tourists came here last year," Lieutenant General DP Pandey said. He also stated that terrorist recruitments had also come down in J&K.

155.title: Hong Kong mortuaries deploy mobile fridges amid surge in COVID deaths
155.article_body: Mortuaries in Hong Kong have deployed mobile refrigeration units to store bodies amid a surge in COVID-19 deaths in the city. Hong Kong had a capacity to store 1,350 bodies at the start of March, according to a Bloomberg report. The Department of Health is working to boost the capacity to store 300 more bodies, the report said.

156.title: 3 students on motorcycle killed after truck runs them over in MP
156.article_body: Three students were killed after a speeding truck, coming from the opposite direction, collided with their motorcycle and ran over them in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district on Saturday, police said. The truck driver has been arrested and his vehicle impounded, police added. The victims were returning home after appearing for their class 10 exams at the time of the incident.

157.title: 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is the craziest film I've ever done: Taika
157.article_body: Filmmaker-actor Taika Waititi has said that he has done crazy sh*t in his life but 'Thor: Love and Thunder' is the craziest film he's ever done. Taika further said, "If you wrote down all the elements of this film, it shouldn't make sense. It's almost like it shouldn't be made...I mean, you'd never work again. Maybe I won't after this."

158.title: MLA suspended from Guj Assembly for 1 week over unparliamentary word
158.article_body: Congress MLA Punja Vansh was on Friday suspended from the Gujarat Assembly for seven days for allegedly using an unparliamentary word in the House. The Congress legislators staged a walkout from the Assembly over his suspension. "When the member has expressed regret over his words, such proposals should be withdrawn," said Shailesh Parmar, Deputy Leader of the Opposition.

159.title: Dynasts want to serve self-interests: PM on Opp'n amid Ukraine war
159.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday said dynasts were looking to serve their self-interests over the Ukraine crisis. "If India's security forces...deal with a crisis, Opposition parties do everything to make the situation more critical," PM Modi said at an election rally in Uttar Pradesh. "We saw this during the pandemic and today during the Ukraine crisis," he added.

160.title: Ukrainian crowd hides under a damaged bridge, pic goes viral
160.article_body: A picture featuring a crowd gathered under a damaged bridge in Ukraine is being widely circulated on social media. The National Guard of Ukraine while tweeting the picture, wrote, "Tragic photo of the day...Hundreds of Ukrainians are hiding under the ruins of the bridge from the strikes of the Russian fascists' aircraft and artillery."

161.title: Pic of Taliban's Sirajuddin Haqqani, FBI's most wanted terrorist, released for 1st time
161.article_body: The Taliban has for the first time put out a picture of its interior minister, Sirajuddin Haqqani, who is among FBI's most wanted terrorists. The picture was tweeted by Zabihullah Mujahid, spokesperson of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. The US Department of State is offering a reward of up to $10 million for information leading directly to his arrest.

162.title: Change MCI rules to open more medical colleges: Gehlot to Centre
162.article_body: Talking about the Ukraine crisis, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Saturday suggested changing rules of Medical Council of India (MCI) to open more colleges in the country. "Both government and private sectors should be allowed to open more...medical colleges," he added. The scheme to open one medical college in each district is not enough due to increasing population, Gehlot said.

163.title: BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi's son joins Samajwadi Party
163.article_body: Mayank Joshi, son of BJP MP from Prayagraj Rita Bahuguna Joshi, joined the Samajwadi Party (SP) on Saturday, hours before the campaign ended for the final phase of the UP Assembly polls. Joshi joined the SP during an election rally in Azamgarh. Notably, Rita Bahuguna Joshi declined to comment on the development and said that she'll remain in the BJP.

164.title: Psychologist said ex-NSE CEO Chitra was evasive during probe: CBI
164.article_body: During the hearing of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application in connection with co-location case, the CBI said a senior forensic psychologist was roped in to extract facts from Ramkrishna. "The...psychologist...observed that [Ramkrishna] was evasive in her responses. She always attributed knowledge regarding matters to her lower functionaries," the CBI told the court.

165.title: Western sanctions on Russia are akin to declaration of war: Putin
165.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that Western sanctions on Russia over the invasion of Ukraine, "are akin to a declaration of war", adding, "But thank God it has not come to that." Putin reiterated that he aims to defend Russian speaking communities in Ukraine through the "demilitarisation and de-Nazification" of the country so that it becomes neutral.

166.title: Madhya Pradesh govt increases DA for state govt employees to 31%
166.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to increase the dearness allowance for state government employees to 31%, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Saturday. The payment for the same will start from April 2022. He further announced that the state government will also give an additional ₹25,000 to girl students under the "Ladli Laxmi scheme" on taking admission in the college.

167.title: Russian billionaires' luxury yachts, villas worth $156 million seized by Italy
167.article_body: Italian authorities have seized luxury yachts and villas worth $156 million from sanctioned Russian billionaires since Friday. Italy has impounded yachts belonging to Russia's richest man, Alexei Mordashov and Gennady Timchenko, a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Further, reports said villas owned by billionaire Alisher Usmanov and state TV host Vladimir Soloviev were also seized.

168.title: Two Kerala nurses chosen for best COVID-19 vaccinators' award
168.article_body: Two nurses from Kerala have been selected for the best vaccinators' award as part of the national COVID-19 vaccination programme. They will be honoured in Delhi on March 8 on the occasion of International Women's Day. "Priya...and T Bhavani...have been selected as the best vaccinators from Kerala," Kerala Health Minister Veena George said.

169.title: Singapore announces sanctions against Russia over invasion of Ukraine
169.article_body: Singapore on Saturday announced sanctions against four Russian banks and an export ban on electronics, computers and military items in response to unprovoked Russian attack on Ukraine. The measures prohibit Singapore's institutions to enter into any transactions with the sanctioned banks. The institutions are also banned from providing services facilitating fundraising for Russian government.

170.title: Death toll among Ukrainian civilians due to conflict rises to 351
170.article_body: The United Nations (UN) on Saturday said that at least 351 Ukrainian civilians have been killed in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine on February 24. Around 707 people have been injured in the conflict, it added. "The real figures are considerably higher, especially in Government-controlled territory and especially in recent days," it further said.

171.title: Ex-Punjab minister booked for assaulting man on polling day
171.article_body: Former Punjab minister and BJP leader Rana Gurmit Singh Sodhi along with six others were booked on Friday on assault and intimidation charges. According to the FIR, a man, identified as Surjit Singh, was allegedly thrashed by Rana Gurmit and others on polling day in Ferozepur. Meanwhile, a counter-complaint has also been filed by Rana Gurmit against Surjit.

172.title: Gujarat IFS officer suspended for alleged financial irregularities
172.article_body: The Gujarat government has ordered immediate suspension of IFS officer KS Randhawa for alleged financial irregularities during his tenure as Managing Director of Gujarat Agro Industries Corporation. "His inefficiency in implementation of Comprehensive Agriculture Business Policy resulted in...liability of ₹540 crore at the end of scheme," an order by state Forest and Environment Department said.

173.title: US Secy of State Blinken visits Poland amid Russia-Ukraine war
173.article_body: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Poland on Saturday amid Russia-Ukraine war. Blinken met Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki and discussed stepping up sanctions on Russia. "My visit to Poland has come at one of the most urgent moments in the long history between our two countries," said Blinken. He also met Polish Foreign Minister Zbigniew Rau.

174.title: PM chairs another high-level meeting on Ukraine war, evacuation of students
