347.article_body: Kapil Dev took to Instagram to condole the demise of ex-Australia wicketkeeper Rodney Marsh and Shane Warne, stating that Rodney set the standards for wicketkeeping at an almost unattainable level. "Shane, you lived your life king size," added Kapil in his post. "Stunned and miserable. Will miss you Warnie. Will...treasure our on field duels," read a tweet from Sachin Tendulkar.

348.title: Container truck crashes into houses in Maha; residents narrowly escape
348.article_body: Residents had a narrow escape after an overspeeding container truck crashed into two houses and a shop in Maharashtra's Kolad along the Mumbai-Goa Highway. "The container went at least 10 feet inside and caused major structural damage to both the houses and the shop," a police official said. The driver was injured and is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

349.title: Mobile phone theft leads to shootout with Delhi Police, 2 held
349.article_body: Two men have been arrested for allegedly snatching a man's mobile phone and firing at the police in Delhi. The police laid a trap to catch the suspects, who earlier managed to escape after snatching a mobile phone. The suspects fired on police after getting trapped and during return fire, one got injured. Both were arrested after the shootout.

350.title: Gujarat shopkeeper chokes girl to death, attempts suicide in hotel room
350.article_body: A 21-year-old shopkeeper from Gujarat's Kutch was booked for allegedly choking a girl to death using packaging tape inside a hotel room in Rajkot. Later, the accused attempted suicide before he was rushed to a hospital, where his condition is stated to be critical. "Apparently, the couple was into some relationship, but somehow things went awry," an officer said.

351.title: Tesla German Gigafactory gets conditional approval for production
351.article_body: Tesla's Gigafactory near Berlin has received a conditional go-ahead, ending months of delay. However, Tesla cannot start production right away. The licence is subject to a public objection period as well as other final inspection conditions that include air pollution control and water usage. Tesla intends to produce up to 5,00,000 vehicles per year at the plant.

352.title: Russia declares ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors
352.article_body: Russia has declared ceasefire in Ukraine to open humanitarian corridors for civilians. Russian military said it is halting its offensive so residents can leave Mariupol and Volnovakha. Following the second round of negotiations between the two countries, a Ukrainian official had said that Russia agreed on humanitarian corridors to evacuate civilians.

353.title: Thai man jailed for putting a sticker on King's portrait during protest
353.article_body: A court in Thailand on Friday sentenced a 33-year-old man to two years in prison for insulting the monarchy, his lawyers said. Narin Kulpongsathorn was allegedly found guilty of putting a sticker bearing the logo of a political satire Facebook page on a large portrait of King Maha Vajiralongkorn outside the Supreme Court during a political rally in 2020.

354.title: 'Game of Thrones' actor John Stahl passes away aged 68
354.article_body: 'Game of Thrones' actor John Stahl has passed away aged 68, his agent said in a statement. He died on Isle of Lewis in Scotland on March 2 and is survived by his wife, Jane Paton, the statement read. John Stahl played Rickard Karstark in 'Game of Thrones' and was also known for playing Inverdarroch in 'Take The High Road'.

355.title: B'luru police file charge sheet against 11 in Bitcoin drugs case
355.article_body: Bengaluru police have filed a charge sheet against 11 people, including a hacker called 'Sriki', in a case regarding the purchase of drugs from dark web using Bitcoin. The case had brought to light other cases involving 'Sriki', like the ₹11.5 crore cybertheft from the Karnataka e-governance cell in 2019. A former MLA's son is also accused in the case.

356.title: Masked persons hurl crude bomb outside expelled BJP leader's house in Manipur
356.article_body: Two masked persons hurled a crude bomb outside the residence of expelled BJP leader Chongtham Bijoy Singh in Lamphel area of Manipur's Imphal West on Friday night, according to police. Nobody was injured in the blast triggered by the miscreants, who came in a two-wheeler vehicle, police added. "The attack might be a threat...to make me politically silent," Bijoy said.

357.title: IAF postpones Exercise Vayu Shakti 2022 to be held in Raj on March 7
357.article_body: Indian Air Force (IAF) has postponed Exercise Vayu Shakti 2022 which was scheduled to be held in Rajasthan on March 7, officials said. PM Narendra Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh were scheduled to attend the exercise, in which Rafale aircraft was slated to participate for the first time. The Defence Ministry had earlier announced postponing of DefExpo 2022.

358.title: Paragliding, balloon flights restricted ahead of PM Modi's Pune visit
358.article_body: Pune's district administration has restricted all paragliding activities and balloon flights ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the district. As per an order issued by District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh, the restriction will last till midnight on March 6. The order states that action will be taken against the violators under Section 188 of the Indian Penal Code.

359.title: Shocking: SC on Punjab & Haryana HC granting protection to ex-DGP
359.article_body: Commenting on Punjab and Haryana HC order, which granted protection from arrest to former Punjab Director General of Police (DGP) Sumedh Singh Saini, Supreme Court said it was "shocked". "How can future course of action be stayed?" SC added. HC granted protection to Saini in pending cases, except Balwant Singh Multani murder case, and cases likely to be registered.

360.title: I wanted a sibling for Vir, wanted a little daughter: Mandira on adopting Tara
360.article_body: Mandira Bedi, in an interview, opened up on her decision to adopt Tara and said that she "wanted a little daughter" and a sibling for her son, Vir. "I love making her hair and putting bows in her hair and dressing her up. It feels like I've got a little doll to play with. She's so cute...and adorable," Mandira added.

361.title: N Korea fires suspected ballistic missile into sea, 9th test this year
361.article_body: North Korea on Saturday fired a suspected ballistic missile into the sea off its east coast, South Korea and Japan said. This is Pyongyang's ninth missile test so far this year. South Korean military said the projectile reached a height of 560 km and flew a distance of 270 km. The launch comes days before South Korea's Presidential election.

362.title: 2 killed in poll-related violence in Manipur as voting for Assembly elections underway
362.article_body: Two people were killed in separate incidents of poll-related violence in Manipur as voting is underway for the second and last phase of state Assembly elections on Saturday. The first incident took place in Thoubal district and the second in Senapati. The last phase of the 2022 Manipur Assembly polls has 92 candidates contesting across 22 Assembly constituencies.

363.title: What was the greatest India XI picked by Shane Warne?
363.article_body: Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52, had picked greatest India XI in 2020, which included players he played against in international career. He had named Sourav Ganguly as captain and picked Virender Sehwag and Navjot Singh Sidhu as openers. Other players included Rahul Dravid, Sachin Tendulkar, Mohammed Azharuddin, Kapil Dev, Nayan Mongia, Harbhajan Singh, Anil Kumble and Javagal Srinath.

364.title: Ravindra Jadeja smashes Test hundred after over 3 years, does sword-wielding celebration
364.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja smashed his second Test hundred after reaching the three-figure mark off 160 deliveries on the second day of the first Test against Sri Lanka in Mohali. Jadeja did the sword-wielding celebration after reaching his hundred. His first Test hundred had come against West Indies in October 2018.

365.title: BMC allots land for 'Dabbawala Bhavan' in Bandra
365.article_body: The BMC general body approved the 'Dabbawala Bhavan' project in Bandra with Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar handing over the land to the President of Mumbai Tiffin Box Suppliers Association (Dabbawale), Ramdas Karwande. The Bhavan was first proposed by the Shiv Sena in its 2017 BMC election manifesto. However, it was kept aside due to non-availability of land in the city.

366.title: Won't do so unless at gunpoint: Elon Musk on Starlink blocking Russian news sources
366.article_body: World's richest person and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "Starlink has been told by some governments (not Ukraine) to block Russian news sources." "We will not do so unless at gunpoint. Sorry to be a free speech absolutist," he said. In an earlier tweet, he wrote, "My sympathies to the...people of Russia, who do want this (war)."

367.title: People pay respects with beers and cigarettes at Warne's statue in Australia
367.article_body: People paid their respects at the base of a statue of former Australian cricket great Shane Warne at the Melbourne Cricket Ground with flowers, beers and cigarettes. Warne passed away at the age of 52 in Thailand. "It was pretty devastating to lose a childhood hero," said a man who came to the MCG to pay his respects.

368.title: I would probably be in jail if I did that: Serena on Zverev's outburst against umpire
368.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev being thrown out of a tournament last month for smashing racquet against the umpire's chair, Serena Williams said, "There is absolutely a double standard...I'd probably be in jail if I did that." Notably, Serena was placed on probation for two years by Grand Slam committee for a "major offence of aggravated behaviour" at US Open 2009.

369.title: K'taka CM proposes freeing temples from govt control in state Budget
369.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister BS Bommai while presenting the state Budget on Friday proposed to free temples from government control by giving autonomy to those coming under the Endowment department. "Necessary legal action will be taken to delegate the discretion of developmental works to the temples," Bommai said. A total of 34,563 temples in Karnataka comes under the Endowment Department.

370.title: 6 arrested for shooting two realtors dead on Hyderabad outskirts
370.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Thursday arrested six accused in connection with the murder of two realtors on the outskirts of the city. "The motive behind the realtors' murder case is land disputes," said Mahesh Bhagwat, Rachakonda Commissioner of Police. According to police, main accused, Matta Reddy, had hatched the murder conspiracy along with his watchman by procuring firearms from Bihar.

371.title: Breathalyser tests to check drunk driving resume in Gurugram after 2 years
371.article_body: After being paused due to the fear of the spread of COVID-19 in March 2020, breathalyser tests resumed to check drunk driving in Gurugram on Friday. The city police have decided to resume the tests a day after the Golf Course Road accident in which four employees of a restaurant were killed by a speeding vehicle.

372.title: Entire world will pay the price if Russia-Ukraine war continues: Rajnath Singh
372.article_body: Addressing a public rally in Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli, Indian Defence Minister Rajnath Singh warned if the war between Russia and Ukraine continues it'll cause more trouble. "Most nations that import oil, gas from Russia...US has imposed sanctions on Russia...If their economies are affected, the entire world will have to pay the price and India will not be spared," he said.

373.title: Medical students who returned from Ukraine can complete internship in India: NMC
373.article_body: The National Medical Commission (NMC) has said that medical students who have returned to India from Ukraine due to the war can complete their internship in India after clearing Foreign Medical Graduate Examination. "Considering the agony and stress faced by these foreign medical graduates, their application to complete the remaining part of internship in India is considered eligible," NMC added.

374.title: Relay room catches fire at Pune's Dapodi Rly Station; no one hurt
374.article_body: The relay room at Pune's Dapodi Railway Station caught fire at 7.15 pm on Friday and affected the movement of five trains on the Pune-Mumbai route for 40 minutes, according to a railway spokesperson. Officials said that no one was injured in the fire which was extinguished in half an hour. The reason behind the fire is to be ascertained.

375.title: Mob attacks police, torches vehicle after woman dies in accident in WB
375.article_body: A police team was allegedly attacked by a mob after a woman died in an accident at Digha-Nandakumar national highway in West Bengal's Daisai town. They also set a vehicle on fire and vandalised the police car. The woman died on the spot after a passenger pick-up van that she was travelling in collided with a dumper truck on Friday.

376.title: 4 sexual assault cases against Kochi tattoo artist after 18-yr-old alleges rape
376.article_body: Days after an 18-year-old girl, in a social media post, alleged she was raped in a popular tattoo studio in Kerala's Kochi, police registered four sexual assault cases against the tattoo artist. Kochi Police Commissioner said four women came forward to register formal complaints after enough persuasion. "We have some clues about the accused. He'll be arrested soon," he added.

377.title: Don't let Putin turn Ukraine into Syria: Ukrainian Foreign Min to NATO
377.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba attended a meeting of NATO Foreign Ministers on Friday and urged the military alliance to act now before it's "too late". "Don't let Putin turn Ukraine into Syria," he said.  "We are ready to fight. We will continue fighting, but we need partners to help us with concrete, resolute and swift actions, now," he added.

378.title: Drone movement detected along IB in Raj, J&K in separate incidents
378.article_body: BSF has opened fire at two drones along International Border (IB) in Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar and Jammu and Kashmir's (J&K) Arnia in separate incidents. Drone movement was detected in Sri Ganganagar between Friday and Saturday, while in Arnia it was around 4.10am on Saturday. Earlier, J&K police seized an arms cache allegedly dropped by a Pakistani drone in Treva.

379.title: Death toll from blast at illegal firecracker unit in Bihar rises to 14; SHO suspended
379.article_body: The death toll from the explosion at a house in Bihar's Bhagalpur has reached 14. Police suspect that the occupants of the house were illegally manufacturing firecrackers. Bhagalpur SSP said a Special Investigation Team (SIT) has been constituted to investigate the case. Tatarpur SHO has been suspended on charges of dereliction of duty.

380.title: Haryana introduces Bill to stop 'forcible' conversions amid protests
380.article_body: Haryana government on Friday introduced the Prevention of Unlawful Conversion of Religion Bill, 2022 in the Legislative Assembly amid protests from the Opposition. A Congress MLA tore a copy of the Bill after it was introduced by state Home Minister Anil Vij. "The Bill does not discriminate against any religion...meant to prevent only 'forcible conversions'," CM Manohar Lal Khattar said.

381.title: Private schools in Chandigarh allowed 8% fee hike for 2022-23 session
381.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has allowed private unaided schools in the UT to impose an 8% hike in the upcoming 2022-2023 session. "Private schools must not raise their fees this year as well," Chandigarh Parents' Association said. Earlier, in June 2020, the administration had directed private unaided schools to charge only tuition fees and not increase fees for the 2020-2021 session.

382.title: We are too critical of Kohli, he was in absolute control: Gambhir
382.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's 45 in the first innings of India's opening Test against Sri Lanka, Gautam Gambhir said we are "too critical" of Kohli at times, adding that he was in "absolute control" before being dismissed. "Even if he plays one bad shot, we say lapse in concentration," stated Gambhir. Kohli was dismissed by Lasith Embuldeniya.

383.title: Russian soldiers raping women in occupied cities: Ukraine
383.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said Russian soldiers are raping women in occupied cities. "When bombs fall on your cities, when soldiers rape women in occupied cities...it's difficult of course to speak about efficiency of international law," he added. "Russia, as a country that committed an act of aggression, will be held accountable for its deeds," he further said.

384.title: Thousands left without internet after cyberattack in Europe
384.article_body: Thousands of European users have been left without internet after a cyberattack reportedly took place at the start of Russia's invasion in Ukraine. According to Orange, nearly 9,000 subscribers of its service in France are without internet after a "cyber event" on February 24 at US satellite operator Viasat. French Space Commander General Michel Friedling confirmed the cyberattack on Viasat.

385.title: Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil, gas output: Tesla CEO Musk
385.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to discuss the need to increase oil and gas output, saying, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately." He acknowledged the move would "negatively affect Tesla", however, he further said, "Sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil & gas exports."

386.title: Russia's 4th richest person's ₹543 crore superyacht seized by Italy
386.article_body: Italian authorities have detained the superyacht of Russian billionaire Alexey Mordashov, who was recently sanctioned by European Union, in the coastal city of Imperia. The 56-year-old Chairman of Russian steel industry firm Severstal is Russia's fourth richest person with a $20.1 billion fortune, as per Bloomberg. His 215-foot yacht named 'Lady M' is worth €65 million (₹543 crore).

387.title: Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' earns ₹100 crore worldwide
387.article_body: Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' has crossed the ₹100 crore mark worldwide in the first week of its release. The film has earned ₹108.3 crore so far at the worldwide box office, Bhansali Productions shared on Friday. According to film trade analyst Taran Adarsh, the Sanjay Leela Bhansali directorial has earned ₹68.93 crore in India so far.

388.title: No idea what’s going on in Pant's head but he is a must watch: Vaughan
388.article_body: Terming Rishabh Pant as the "greatest" modern day entertainer, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan tweeted he has no idea what's going on in Pant's head but he is always a must watch. "I don't want to miss a ball he faces," added Vaughan in his tweet. Pant scored 96 runs in the first innings of India's Mohali Test against Sri Lanka.

389.title: Fight erupts between students over hijab issue at Mangaluru college
389.article_body: Two complaints were filed after a fight erupted between a group of male students and female students over hijab issue on Friday at a college in Karnataka's Mangaluru. A day before, five hijab-wearing students weren't allowed to give their exams after a few students objected and when the former returned the next day the fight erupted, a police official said.

390.title: He once was an enemy on the pitch, became a great friend off it: Vaughan on Warne
390.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan, while condoling Shane Warne's demise, said that Warne once was his enemy on the pitch, but became a great friend off it. "Shane was the greatest ever cricketer but more than that his character lit up every dressing room, commentary box, bar, golf club and friendship group," he added.

391.title: Taliban praises wheat sent by India, says 'Pakistan gave rotten, inedible wheat'
391.article_body: The Taliban has criticised Pakistan for donating poor quality wheat to Afghanistan as it praised the quality of wheat sent by India. "Wheat donated by Pakistan is rotten and inedible," a Taliban official said. Last month, India sent 50 trucks stacked with around 2,500 tons of wheat to Afghanistan to help relieve food shortages.

392.title: 3,200 ganja laced chocolates seized in Bengaluru, 2 arrested
392.article_body: The Mahadevapura Police arrested two people who hailed from Odisha on Friday for being involved in the supply of ganja laced chocolates to Bengaluru. The police seized 3,200 such chocolates weighing 18 kg. On Wednesday, the Bengaluru's Railway Protection Force (RPF) had seized 7.1 kg of ganja worth ₹4,26,000 at Banaswadi Railway Station under its operation NARCOS.

393.title: Shooting stones block Jammu-Srinagar National Highway
393.article_body: After being blocked on Thursday due to the landslides, the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway was blocked again on Saturday, this time due to shooting stones. The J&K Traffic Police said that the highway has been blocked at Panthyal and vehicular movement will be suspended until the clearance work completes. The highway connects Kashmir with the rest of India.

394.title: Greenlight to bombing: Zelenskyy on NATO rejecting no-fly zone request
394.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned NATO's decision to rule out the implementation of a no-fly zone over his country. "Knowing that new strikes and casualties are inevitable, NATO deliberately decided not to close the sky over Ukraine," Zelenskyy said. With this decision, the alliance has given Russia "the green light to the bombing of Ukrainian cities and villages", he added.

395.title: Supreme Court stays Delhi HC order allowing citizens to feed stray dogs
395.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday stayed a Delhi High Court order permitting citizens to feed stray dogs in every residential society. Pointing out its 2015 decision, the SC issued notice on a petition filed by an animal welfare society. The 2015 decision prohibits High Courts from passing orders pertaining to dogs under the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act, 1960.

396.title: Households in Secunderabad Cantonment to get free drinking water
396.article_body: The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB) announced the extension of its free drinking water supply scheme to areas under Secunderabad Cantonment Board. Free drinking water up to 20 kilolitres per month will be provided to every household in the cantonment. The Telangana government has sanctioned a budget of ₹16.8 crore per year on account of the scheme.

397.title: Ukraine spends $15 mn of $50-mn crypto donation on military gear
397.article_body: The Ukrainian government has already spent $15 million of the donations it received in cryptocurrencies on military supplies, including bulletproof vests. The Crypto Fund of Ukraine had raised $50 million in crypto in a week to support Ukraine. The government aims to double the $50 million donated so far in the next two or three days.

398.title: Absorb Ukraine-returned medical students in Indian colleges: TS Singh Deo
398.article_body: Chhattisgarh Health Minister TS Singh Deo has written a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya expressing concern about the "further education" of the Ukraine-returned medical students. Deo has requested the Centre to absorb them in Indian medical colleges since there is uncertainty about when normalcy will return back to war-hit Ukraine.

399.title: Madurai govt officials to walk, use buses on Wed to curb pollution
399.article_body: According to a circular issued by Tamil Nadu's Madurai District Collector S Aneesh Sekhar, government officials in the district have been told to use buses or walk to offices on Wednesdays every week. It has been done in an effort to control air pollution in the district. This comes following a similar circular issued by Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board.

400.title: Putin signs law introducing jail for 'fake news' on army; CNN, BBC suspend operations
400.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed into law a bill introducing jail terms of up to 15 years for "fake news" about the Russian army. The bill sets out jail terms of varying lengths and fines against people who publish "knowingly false information". Following the news, BBC, Bloomberg and CNN announced that they will temporarily halt operations in the country.

401.title: Shane Warne rightly predicted India-England 2011 World Cup match to be a tie
401.article_body: Before India-England 2011 World Cup match on February 27, 2011, Shane Warne put out a tweet predicting the match would end in a tie. Warne's prediction came true when England scored 338/8 in reply to India's 338, and he was termed a 'genius' by then England captain Andrew Strauss. Warne passed away aged 52 on Friday.
